intro: Minuartia stojanovii, commonly known as the Balkan sandwort, is a low-growing flowering plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is native to the Balkan Peninsula and thrives in rocky and sandy soils, often found in alpine and subalpine environments. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in early summer, typically from June to July. Its leaves are linear and closely spaced, forming a dense mat that helps it survive in harsh, arid conditions. Minuartia stojanovii is a perennial species that is adapted to withstand extreme temperature fluctuations and limited moisture availability.
